  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Samsung Electronics is turning to artificial intelligence (AI) features to revamp its flagship Galaxy smartphones, betting that the technology can give it an advantage over Apple’s iPhone.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 现在分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示三星电子求助于人工智能 (AI) 功能来改造其旗舰 Galaxy 智能手机，押注这项技术可以使其在竞争中获得优势相比苹果的 iPhone。

  • 非限制性定语从句 - 表示对先行词的补充说明，从句与先行词之间用逗号隔开。

    原文例句：Samsung Electronics is turning to artificial intelligence (AI) features to revamp its flagship Galaxy

    • The Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra can live-translate phone calls, transcribe voice recordings, summarise web articles and fix handwriting
    • Apple is not expected to showcase its latest plans for artificial intelligence until June, ahead of new iPhones arriving around September

    Samsung Electronics is turning to artificial intelligence (AI) features to revamp its flagship Galaxy smartphones, betting that the technology can give it an advantage over Apple’s iPhone.

    At its Unpacked conference Wednesday in San Jose, California, Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S24, S24+ and S24 Ultra phones, which all add AI tools based on the Gemini technology from Alphabet’s Google.

    The devices can live-translate phone calls, transcribe voice recordings, summarise web articles, fix handwriting and use generative AI to fill in parts of photos.

    The launch is one of the most ambitious attempts to weave AI into a smartphone’s interface and features. The new devices also provide Google with a chance to put its most advanced software in the hands of more users, a potential edge in its fight for AI dominance with Microsoft and start-up OpenAI.

    The AI features are the highlight of the new phones, but the devices are also getting slimmer bezels and brighter displays. Samsung is paying special attention to its top-end model, the S24 Ultra. That product, which starts at US$1,299, will have a new titanium frame, matching the iPhone 15 Pro models released in September.

    The borders around the displays are 42 per cent thinner, and the screen is 40 per cent brighter than the phone’s predecessor. It also sports flatter edges and a front-facing camera cut-out that is 11 per cent smaller.

    The US$799 S24 and US$999 S24+ come in aluminium and get slightly larger screens than their predecessors, moving from 6.1-inch and 6.6-inch panels to 6.2-inch and 6.7-inch displays, respectively. The S24 Ultra, like the S23 Ultra, has a 6.8-inch screen.

    Qualcomm is providing the main chip of the new Samsung phones in at least some regions. The S24 line-up will be based on its Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 applications processor, the company said in a separate statement. That component offers the latest Wi-fi capabilities and will handle AI-assisted features such as live translation and transcription, Qualcomm said.

    The new models come at a crucial time for Samsung, which is contending with market share losses and a broader smartphone slump. Last year, it lost its crown as the No 1 smartphone supplier to Apple, marking the first time Samsung has not led the market since 2010.

    Samsung’s phone shipments declined nearly 14 per cent to 226.6 million units in 2023, according to research firm IDC. Apple, on the other hand, saw unit shipments increase 3.7 per cent to 234.6 million.

    Samsung looks to reverse its fortunes by getting a several-month head start on AI. Apple is not expected to showcase its latest plans for artificial intelligence until June, ahead of new iPhones arriving around September. The new Galaxy phones come out on January 31, with pre-orders starting Wednesday.

    Samsung decided to adopt the Gemini AI technology after surveying offerings from competitors, according to Thomas Kurian, head of Google’s cloud computing unit. As part of a multi-year agreement, Google will be the sole provider of generative AI for Samsung’s phones and applications, including features for taking notes and recording audio, according to Kurian.

    “This is a validation of the quality of our models,” Kurian said. “They were free to choose whoever they wanted.”

    Users will be able to switch between two options: one called Gemini Nano that runs on the phone itself and a higher-powered Pro version that uses cloud computing. That flexibility helped Google’s offerings stand out from the competition, Kurian said.

    In conjunction with Samsung’s announcements, Google also introduced a feature called “Circle to Search,” which lets people search anything on their phone screens without switching apps.

    Users of Google’s Android operating system can scribble or circle on top of images, text or video in the app they are on – say, YouTube Shorts or TikTok – to find out more information about the item. The feature is launching globally on the new Galaxy S24, as well as on Google’s own Pixel 8 smartphones on January 31.

    AI features on the Samsung devices will also let users change the language of a message depending on the context, such as whether it is a work memo or social media post. And new capabilities for Android Auto – Google’s in-car interface – will summarise incoming text messages and other alerts.

    The companies are also applying AI to the phones’ camera systems, which are getting upgraded with new sensors, with tools to make photos sharper. The S24 Ultra replaces one of its 10-megapixel telephoto cameras with a 50-megapixel version. The S24 and S24+, meanwhile, include the same camera specifications as their predecessors.

    The S24 Ultra comes with as much as 1 terabyte of storage, while the S24+ tops out at 512 gigabytes. The S24 has as much as 256GB of space. The S24+ and S24 Ultra include 12GB of memory, which is used for shorter-term storage of data, while the regular S24 has 8GB.

item.title: Google to let global Android users search for content within other apps
item.description:
Summary：

谷歌宣布推出“圆形搜索”新功能，允许用户在不离开应用程序的情况下搜索信息，从而提高用户粘性和搜索引擎业务。该功能将于1月31日开始在部分 Android 手机上推出，但尚未透露何时会在 iPhone 上推出。早期的测试表明，用户在激活该功能后通常会返回他们正在使用的应用程序。
  • Abstract: Google's Circle to Search feature enables users to search for content within other apps without leaving them, aiming to enhance app engagement and drive search engine business.
  • Theme: Google's new feature allows users to search for information without exiting apps, promising to increase user engagement and benefit app developers.
  • Viewpoint: The Circle to Search feature is a strategic move to boost Google's search engine business and drive engagement for app developers.
  • Main information: The feature will be rolled out gradually from January 31 on premium Android smartphones; users can select text, images, or videos in other apps and search them within those apps; Google did not disclose the availability of the feature on iPhones.

总结：

谷歌宣布推出“圆形搜索”新功能，允许用户在不离开应用程序的情况下搜索信息，从而提高用户粘性和搜索引擎业务。该功能将于1月31日开始在部分 Android 手机上推出，但尚未透露何时会在 iPhone 上推出。早期的测试表明，用户在激活该功能后通常会返回他们正在使用的应用程序。
  • 摘要：谷歌的“圆形搜索”功能使用户无需离开其他应用即可在其中搜索内容，旨在提升应用参与度并推动搜索引擎业务。
  • 主题：谷歌的新功能允许用户在不退出应用程序的情况下搜索信息，有望提高用户参与度并使应用程序开发人员受益。
  • 观点：“圆形搜索”功能是谷歌为提振其搜索引擎业务和推动应用程序开发人员参与度而采取的一项战略举措。
  • 主要信息：该功能将于1月31日起在部分高端安卓智能手机上逐步推出；用户可以在其他应用中选择文本、图片或视频，并在这些应用内搜索它们；谷歌并未披露该功能在苹果手机上的可用性。

单词：

  • smartphone (n.) - /ˈsmɑːrtfoʊn/ 智能手机。

    原文例句：Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them, a move aimed at boosting its search engine business and driving engagement for app developers.

    例句讲解：“智能手机”是一个合成词，“smart”意为“聪明的”，而“phone”意为“电话”，“smart phone”直译为“聪明的电话”，因此常被称为“智能手机”。这个词是指一种多功能移动电话，它不仅可以用来通话，还可以运行各种应用程序，比如玩游戏、浏览网页、收发邮件等等。

  • search engine (n.) - /sɜːrtʃ ˈendʒɪn/ 搜索引擎。

    原文例句：Google's new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday.

    例句讲解：“搜索引擎”是一个合成词，“search”意为“搜索”，而“engine”意为“引擎”，“search engine”直译为“搜索引擎”，泛指一种能够帮助用户在网络上搜索信息的工具。常见的搜索引擎有谷歌、百度、雅虎等。

词组：

  • without having to - 不必，无需。

    原文例句：Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them, a move aimed at boosting its search engine business and driving engagement for app developers.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由without（没有）和having to（必须）构成的，表示“不必，无需”。在这个例句中，它表示全球安卓智能手机用户无需退出应用程序即可在其他应用程序中搜索内容。

句子：

  • Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them. - 谷歌将允许全球 Android 智能手机用户在其他应用程序中搜索内容，而无需退出它们。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Google will let，其中主语是Google，谓语是will let。global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them是一个不定式短语作宾语，表示谷歌将允许全球 Android 智能手机用户在其他应用程序中搜索内容，而无需退出它们。

语法：

  • 一般将来时 - 表示将来要发生的事情。

    原文例句：Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them, a move aimed at boosting its search engine business and driving engagement for app developers.

    语法讲解：一般将来时是用来表示将来要发生的事情，其结构是：will/shall + 动词原形。其中will主要用于第一人称和第三人称，shall主要用于第二人称。在这个例句中，will let表示谷歌将允许全球 Android 智能手机用户在其他应用程序中搜索内容。

  • 不定式短语 - 由不定式和不定式作状语构成的短语。

    原文例句：Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them, a move aimed at boosting its search engine business and driving engagement for app developers.

    语法讲解：不定式短语是由不定式和不定式作状语构成的短语，可以用作句子成分，如主语、宾语、表语等。在这个例句中，without having to exit them是一个不定式短语，作状语，表示谷歌将允许全球 Android 智能手机用户在其他应用程序中搜索内容，而无需退出它们。

  • The Circle to Search feature, available from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will enable quick access to information without having to leave the app
  • Google did not disclose when the new function will be available on iPhones

Google will let global Android smartphone users search for content in other applications without having to exit them, a move aimed at boosting its search engine business and driving engagement for app developers.

The company's new Circle to Search feature, to be rolled out “gradually” from January 31 on some premium Android smartphones, will allow users to select text, images or videos in any other apps, and have Google search them within the apps, the US technology giant said on Thursday.

For example, users will be able to search for details on what a content creator is wearing in a video by circling or tapping on the items, after they activate the Circle to Search function by long-pressing their Android phone’s home button or navigation bar, the company said.

The feature will enable quick access to information without having to leave the app, potentially driving engagement for apps and the content displayed, it said.

Apple gets deeper into China’s smartphone price wars with broad iPhone discounts

Early testing showed that users “typically return to the app they’re using” after activating the feature, according to Google.

The company did not disclose when the function will be available on iPhones, with a representative telling the South China Morning Post that it “looks forward to bringing this powerful new capability to more people over time”.

Android handsets that will feature the new function will include Samsung Electronics’ new Galaxy S24 Series, it said.

Google parent Alphabet’s revenue in the three months ending September 30 rose 11 per cent from the same period a year before, which the company attributed to “meaningful growth” in search and YouTube, according to its earnings report published in October. Advertising revenue grew 9.5 per cent year on year to US$59.6 billion.

The company is still facing uncertainties in Hong Kong, where the government is seeking to have the US technology giant remove the protest song “Glory to Hong Kong”, which became popular during anti-government unrest in the city in 2019.

Google has expressed unwillingness to ban the song from its search engine without a court order.

While a Hong Kong court blocked the government’s injunction bid in July, a month later it allowed the city’s government to appeal the decision.

item.title: Huawei sets up new smart car unit as it accelerates automotive ambitions in wake of earlier deal with Changan
item.description:
Summary：

Huawei set up a new smart car company, Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology, with a registered capital of 1 billion yuan. The new company will focus on smart car equipment manufacturing, AI system integration services, and AI software development. This move follows Huawei's memorandum of cooperation with Changan Automobile in November to start a smart car joint venture. Huawei plans to transfer its smart-car system business to the new unit with investments from Changan Automobile and integrate its core technologies and resources into the new company.
  • Abstract: Huawei enters the automobile industry by establishing a new smart car company, Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology.
  • Theme: Huawei's expansion into the smart car sector through partnerships and technology transfer.
  • Viewpoint: Huawei's ambitions in the automobile industry; the potential impact of Huawei's smart car technologies on the market.
  • Main information: Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology's business scope; Huawei's plans to transfer its smart-car system business; Huawei's collaboration with Changan Automobile and other carmakers.

总结：

华为成立了一家新的智能汽车公司，深圳银王智能科技有限公司，注册资本10亿元。新公司将专注于智能汽车设备制造、人工智能系统集成服务、人工智能软件开发等领域。此举是继华为去年11月与长安汽车签署合作备忘录，启动智能汽车合资企业之后。华为计划将其智能汽车系统业务转移至新成立的部门，由长安汽车投资、将华为的智能汽车核心技术与资源整合进新公司。
  • 摘要：华为通过成立新的智能汽车公司深圳银王智能科技有限公司，进军汽车行业。
  • 主题：华为通过合作与技术转让，拓展智能汽车领域的版图。
  • 观点：华为在汽车行业的发展野心；华为智能汽车技术对市场的影响力。
  • 主要信息：深圳银王智能科技的业务范围、华为智能汽车系统业务转移计划、华为与长安汽车及其他汽车厂商的合作。

单词：

  • autonomous (adj.) - /ɔːˈtɑːnəməs/ 自律的，自主的。

    原文例句：Huawei is also developing autonomous driving technologies, and its research arm, Huawei HiSilicon, unveiled a new chip that it said is the world's first AI-powered computing solution for autonomous vehicles.

    例句讲解：autonomous是auto（自动）和-nomous（状态的）构成的，表示“自主的，自控的”。在这个例句中，它描述了华为正在开发自动驾驶技术，并且其研究部门华为海思发布了一款据称是世界上首款用于自动驾驶汽车的人工智能计算解决方案的芯片。

  • telematics (n.) - /tɛlɪˈmætɪks/ 遥测学，远程信息处理。

    原文例句：Telematics involves the integration of telecommunications and informatics, and it has been used in the automotive industry for several years.

    例句讲解：telematics是由telecommunication（电信）和informatics（信息学）构成的，表示“远距离信息传输和处理”。在这个例句中，它涉及到电信和信息学的集成，并且已经在汽车行业使用了很多年了。

词组：

  • in the process of doing something - 正在做某事。

    原文例句：Zhu also said that the two companies are in the process of discussing the details of their partnership and its establishment.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……里面），the（定冠词）和process（过程，进展）构成的，表示“正在进行某事”。在这个例句中，它表示朱还说，这两家公司正在讨论他们合作和建立的细节。

  • focus on - 集中于，专注于。

    原文例句：The Huawei-Changan JV will also be open to more firms, Zhu said, adding that it will focus on seven main businesses including intelligent automotive systems, smart cockpits and a digital platform.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由focus（焦点，关注）和on（在……上面）构成的，表示“集中于，专注于”。在这个例句中，它表示朱还说，华为长安合资公司也将向更多公司开放，并将专注于七大主要业务，包括智能汽车系统、智能驾驶舱和数字平台。

句子：

  • Huawei Technologies has set up a new smart car company as the US-sanctioned telecoms equipment giant steps up its ambitions in the automobile industry. - 华为技术公司成立了一家新的智能汽车公司，这家受到美国制裁的电信设备巨头正在加紧在汽车行业实现其抱负。

    句子分析：这是一个复杂句，主句是Huawei Technologies has set up a new smart car company，其中主语是Huawei Technologies，谓语是has set up，宾语是a new smart car company。as the US-sanctioned telecoms equipment giant steps up its ambitions in the automobile industry是一个现在分词短语作状语，修饰主句，表示华为技术公司成立一家新的智能汽车公司的背景或原因，即随着这家受到美国制裁的电信设备巨头正在加紧在汽车行业实现其抱负。这个句子的意思是说，华为技术公司成立了一家新的智能汽车公司，这家受到美国制裁的电信设备巨头正在加紧在汽车行业实现其抱负。

语法：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子的承受者或接受者来承受或接受。

    原文例句：The new venture was set up by Huawei’s car unit to serve the industry better with its smart car solutions.

    语法讲解：这是一个被动语态的句子，其结构是：be + 过去分词。在这个例句中，be是was，过去分词是set up，主语是The new venture，表示新公司被华为的汽车部门设立。这个句子的意思是说，新公司被设立来更好地为行业服务与华为的智能汽车解决方案。

  • 并列连词 - 表示连接两个或多个词、词组或句子。

    原文例句：The Huawei-Changan JV will also be open to more firms, Zhu said, adding that it will focus on seven main businesses including intelligent automotive systems, smart cockpits and a digital platform. - 朱还说，华为长安合资公司也将向更多公司开放，并将专注于七大主要业务，包括智能汽车系统、智能驾驶舱和数字平台。

    语法讲解：这是一个使用并列连词and的句子，它连接了两个句子：The Huawei-Changan JV will also be open to more firms和it will focus on seven main businesses including intelligent automotive systems, smart cockpits and a digital platform。第一个句子说明了华为长安合资公司将向更多公司开放，第二个句子说明了华为长安合资公司将专注于七大主要业务。这个句子的意思是说，华为长安合资公司也将向更多公司开放，并将专注于七大主要业务，包括智能汽车系统、智能驾驶舱和数字平台。

  • The new company, named Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology, has a registered capital of 1 billion yuan
  • Development comes after Huawei signed a memorandum of cooperation in November with Changan Automobile

Huawei Technologies has set up a new smart car company as the US-sanctioned telecoms equipment giant steps up its ambitions in the automobile industry, following its earlier announcement of a joint venture (JV) with Chinese state-owned carmaker Changan Automobile.

The new company, named Shenzhen Yinwang Intelligent Technology, was set up on Tuesday with a registered capital of 1 billion yuan (US$140.3 million) and is wholly owned by Huawei, according to records on business registry information platform Tianyancha.

The records show that the new firm’s business covers smart car equipment manufacturing, artificial intelligence (AI) system integration services, and AI software development, among other areas.

The development comes after Huawei signed a memorandum of cooperation in November with Changan Automobile, a major state-owned carmaker based in Chongqing, southwestern Sichuan province, to start a new smart car JV.

Under the partnership, Huawei said it plans to transfer its smart-car system business to a new unit with investments from Changan Automobile and “integrate the core technologies and resources of [Huawei’s] smart car solutions into the new company”.

Huawei’s HarmonyOS tipped to beat Apple’s iOS in China in 2024: TechInsights

The new venture was set up by Huawei’s car unit to serve the industry better with its smart car solutions, according to a person familiar with the situation who declined to be named. Huawei declined to comment on the relationship between the new entity and its JV with Changan.

While Huawei currently holds 100 per cent of the new firm, it is open to more industry partners joining to become a technology platform with diversified equity, according to a report by Chinese media outlet Securities Times.

In November, Richard Yu Chengdong, CEO of Huawei’s consumer business group and chairman of its Intelligent Automotive Solution business unit, called on Chinese carmakers Seres Group, Chery Automobile, JAC Motors and BAIC Motor to take an equity stake in the Huawei-Changan JV.

All four of these companies – generally considered smaller carmakers in the country – currently partner with Huawei to develop and sell new brands under the so-called Huawei Select model, through which the smartphone giant collaborates closely with companies on everything from product design to sales. These brands include Aito with Seres and Luxeed with Chery.

At Changan’s global partnership conference on Tuesday, the automaker’s chairman Zhu Huarong revealed that Huawei had promised not to produce cars under their JV deal, which was sealed within three months of initiating discussions, according to a live-streamed video of the event.

Zhu also said that the two companies are in the process of discussing the details of their partnership and its establishment, which is tentatively named “Newcool” in English.

The Huawei-Changan JV will also be open to more firms, Zhu said, adding that it will focus on seven main businesses including intelligent automotive systems, smart cockpits and a digital platform.

item.title: China’s IC output grew 6.9% in 2023, defying weaker customer demand, tighter US sanctions
item.description:
Summary：

In 2023, despite a decrease in demand, China's total production of integrated circuits (ICs) experienced a 6.9% growth compared to 2022, reaching 351.4 billion units. However, a major foundry, SMIC, faced challenges due to weaker customer demand, resulting in a decline in wafer shipments and capacity utilization. Overall, the semiconductor industry in China encountered difficulties attributed to factors such as the post-pandemic economic recovery, decreased demand from consumer electronics manufacturers, and strict US-led sanctions restricting access to advanced technologies.
  • Abstract: China's IC output grew in 2023 despite industry challenges.
  • Theme: The dynamics and challenges faced by China's semiconductor industry in 2023.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of maintaining a balanced and resilient semiconductor supply chain in the face of global economic and technological shifts.
  • Main information: China's IC production growth; SMIC's capacity utilization decline; contributing factors including economic recovery, consumer demand, and US sanctions; industry analysts' predictions for the current quarter.

总结：

2023年，尽管需求下降，但中国集成电路（IC）总产量与2022年相比增长6.9%，达到3514亿片。然而，由于客户需求疲软，主要晶圆厂中芯国际面临挑战，导致晶圆出货量和产能利用率下降。总体而言，中国半导体行业在后疫情经济复苏、消费电子制造商需求下降以及美国主导的限制获得先进技术制裁等因素的影响下，遭遇困难。
  • 摘要：中国IC产量在2023年增长，但行业面临挑战。
  • 主题：2023年中国半导体行业的动态和面临的挑战。
  • 观点：在全球经济和技术变革的情况下，保持平衡和弹性的半导体供应链的重要性。
  • 主要信息：中国IC产量增长；中芯国际产能利用率下降；经济复苏、消费需求和美国制裁等影响因素；行业分析师对本季度的预测。

单词：

  • chip (n.) - /tʃɪp/ 芯片，集成电路。

    原文例句：China produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古英语ci(r)p，意为“碎片，小块”。在这个例句中，它指的是集成电路，即电子设备中用于处理信息的微型电子器件。

  • wafer (n.) - /'weɪfə(r)/ 晶圆，硅片。

    原文例句：SMIC’s total shipments of wafers from January to September 2023 declined by 24 per cent year on year.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古英语weafre，意为“圆饼，薄片”。在这个例句中，它指的是硅片，即半导体器件制造的基底材料。

  • capacity utilization (n.) - /kə'pæsəti ju:tɪlaɪ'zeɪʃn/ 产能利用率。

    原文例句：China’s top foundry Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) saw its capacity utilisation rate fall to an average of 74 per cent in the first three quarters of last year

    例句讲解：这个单词是由capacity（容量）和utilization（利用）构成的，意为“产能利用率”。在这个例句中，它指的是中芯国际的产能利用率，即其在一定时期内实际生产的产量与生产能力的比率。

词组：

  • year on year - 同比。

    原文例句：The country produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由year（年）和on year（年）构成的，意为“同比”。在这个例句中，它表示中国去年IC的产量与2022年相比。

  • capacity utilisation rate - 产能利用率。

    原文例句：China’s top foundry Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC) saw its capacity utilisation rate fall to an average of 74 per cent in the first three quarters of last year.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由capacity（容量）和utilisation rate（利用率）构成的，意为“产能利用率”。在这个例句中，它表示中芯国际的平均产能利用率。

句子：

  • China exported a total of 267.8 billion ICs worth US$135.9 billion in 2023, down 1.8 per cent by volume and 10.1 per cent lower in value from 2022. - 2023年，中国出口集成电路总计2678亿片，价值1359亿美元，比2022年数量下降1.8%，价值下降10.1%。

    句子分析：这是一个简单的陈述句，主语是China，谓语是exported，宾语是a total of 267.8 billion ICs，状语是worth US$135.9 billion in 2023, down 1.8 per cent by volume and 10.1 per cent lower in value from 2022。这个句子的意思是，2023年，中国出口集成电路总计2678亿片，价值1359亿美元，比2022年数量下降1.8%，价值下降10.1%。

语法：

  • 过去时 - 表示过去发生的事情或状态。

    原文例句：China’s total output of integrated circuits (ICs) in 2023 increased 6.9 per cent from a year earlier despite sluggish demand at one of its largest wafer foundries in the second half.

    语法讲解：过去时是时态的一种，表示过去发生的事情或状态。在英语中，过去时有简单过去时、过去完成时、过去进行时和过去完成进行时四种。在这个例句中，used表示过去发生的事情，因此用了过去时。

  • The country produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022, according to data published by China’s National Bureau of Statistics
  • SMIC’s total shipments of wafers from January to September 2023 declined by 24 per cent year on year, reflecting weaker demand from its main customers

China’s total output of integrated circuits (ICs) in 2023 increased 6.9 per cent from a year earlier despite sluggish demand at one of its largest wafer foundries in the second half.

The country produced 351.4 billion ICs last year, compared with 324.2 billion in 2022, according to data published on Wednesday by China’s National Bureau of Statistics (NBS).

The NBS data counted a variety of chips to reach the total IC number, including logic, memory, analogue and special chips, plus sensors and chip modules.

In 2023, China’s semiconductor manufacturing industry was marred by factors such as weaker economic post-pandemic recovery, sluggish demand from smartphone and personal-computer makers, and tighter US-led sanctions that restricted its access to advanced technologies.

China chip design expert warns of losses due to industry overcrowding

China’s top foundry Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp (SMIC), which derived 84 per cent of its total revenue from the domestic market in the third quarter, saw its capacity utilisation rate fall to an average of 74 per cent in the first three quarters of last year, compared with 96 per cent in the same period the year before.

SMIC’s total shipments of wafers from January to September 2023 declined by 24 per cent year on year, reflecting weaker demand from its main customers in sectors spanning from smartphones to carmakers.

The company will report its fourth-quarter and full-year results on February 7.

The market softness was also felt by China’s second-largest foundry Hua Hong Semiconductor, which saw revenue in the first nine months of last year drop 0.79 per year on year, while third-quarter capacity utilisation sank to 86.8 per cent from a capacity overload situation in the second quarter, according to data from the company.

Industry analysts have predicted the sluggish demand to continue in the current quarter, with signs of recovery only becoming visible in the second quarter.

Overall semiconductor foundry capacity utilisation rates are still under downward pressure amid the prevailing economic turbulence this quarter, Taiwan-based IC research company TrendForce said in a recent note.

TrendForce predicted that foundry inventory levels will improve in the second quarter, returning to a healthier equilibrium despite the continuing murky outlook for end-customer orders.

Separately, China exported a total of 267.8 billion ICs worth US$135.9 billion in 2023, down 1.8 per cent by volume and 10.1 per cent lower in value from 2022.

Meanwhile, China imported 479.5 billion IC units worth US$349.4 billion, down 10.8 per cent by volume and 15.4 per cent in value from 2022, official data showed.

item.title: China’s internet giants must step up opening their ‘walled gardens’, state media says, ahead of Tencent flagship game’s return to Douyin
item.description:
Summary：

Chinese media urge domestic internet giants to enhance interoperability across platforms, fostering collaboration to counter market pressures and driving industry expansion. Despite the recent return of Tencent's Honor of Kings to Douyin, the level of collaboration among major players remains limited. Increased cooperation is seen as beneficial to consumers and the sector as a whole, particularly in the face of regulatory uncertainties and a weaker macroeconomic environment in China.
  • Abstract: State media call for greater collaboration among Chinese internet companies to address market challenges and promote industry growth.
  • Theme: Need for increased interoperability and cooperation within China's internet landscape to drive industry expansion.
  • Viewpoint: Collaboration among internet companies is crucial for overcoming market pressures and ensuring sustained industry growth.
  • Main information: Tencent's Honor of Kings game returning to Douyin; call for more open-minded and inclusive collaboration; potential benefits for consumers and industry expansion.

总结：

国内媒体呼吁互联网巨头企业提升平台互通性，加强合作，以应对市场压力和推动行业增长。尽管腾讯王者荣耀游戏最近重返抖音，但几大科技企业之间的合作程度仍然有限。增加合作被认为有利于消费者和整个行业，特别是在面对中国监管不确定性和经济环境疲软的情况下。
  • 摘要：国家媒体呼吁中国互联网企业加强合作，以应对市场挑战并促进行业增长。
  • 主题：需要在中国的互联网领域进行增加互操作性和合作，以推动行业扩张。
  • 观点：互联网企业之间的合作对于克服市场压力和确保行业的可持续增长至关重要。
  • 主要信息：腾讯王者荣耀游戏回归抖音；呼吁更开放和包容的合作；对消费者和行业扩张潜在的好处。

单词：

  • collaborate (v.) - 合作，共同努力。

    原文例句：There have been other cases of collaboration between rival internet platform operators over the years,

    例句讲解：这个单词是由col-（共同）和laborare（工作）构成的，表示“共同努力，合作”。在这个例句中，它指的是过去几年中 rival internet platform operators 之间的其他合作案例。

  • interoperability (n.) - 互操作性，可互操作性。

    原文例句：In November 2021, Tencent opened WeChat to third-party online links including those of Douyin and Taobao.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由inter（互相）和operability（可操作性）构成的，表示“互相操作性，可互操作性”。在这个例句中，它指的是2021年11月腾讯向第三方在线链接开放微信，包括抖音和淘宝。

  • leverage (v.) - 利用，发挥杠杆作用。

    原文例句：“Internet companies need to leverage each other to face the market pressures together,”

    例句讲解：这个单词是由lever（杠杆）构成的，表示“利用，发挥杠杆作用”。在这个例句中，它指的是“互联网公司需要相互利用来共同面对市场压力”。

词组：

  • face market pressures - 应对市场压力。

      • 原文例句：“Internet companies need to leverage each other to face the market pressures together,”

      例句讲解：这个词组是由face（面对）, market（市场）和pressure(压力)构成的，表示“应对市场压力”。在这个例句中，它指的是互联网公司需要相互利用来共同应对市场压力。

  • promote truly win-win cooperation - 促进真正实现双赢的合作。

      • 原文例句：“In the future, internet companies need to be more open-minded and inclusive to promote truly win-win cooperation in the industry,”

      例句讲解：这个词组是由promote（促进）, truly（真正）, win-win（双赢）和cooperation（合作）构成的，表示“促进真正实现双赢的合作”。在这个例句中，它指的是互联网公司在未来需要更加开放包容，以在行业内促进真正实现双赢的合作。

句子：

  • There have been other cases of collaboration between rival internet platform operators over the years, - 过去几年中，敌对互联网平台运营商之间还存在其他合作案例。

      • 句子分析：这个句子是由主语There have been other cases of collaboration between rival internet platform operators over the years和谓语-构成的。there have been是have的过去分词，表示过去发生的事情或状态，other表示其他的，cases表示案例，collaboration表示合作，between表示介词，rival表示竞争对手，internet platform表示互联网平台，operators表示运营商，over表示介词，years表示年。这个句子的意思是说，过去几年中，敌对互联网平台运营商之间还存在其他合作案例。

语法：

  • 连词成对使用 - 用于连接词、词组或句子，以表示并列、选择、因果等关系。

      • 原文例句：Last April, Tencent and Douyin agreed to a partnership in video content distribution after years of contentious copyright disputes.

      语法讲解：在这个例句中，连词and被用来连接两个句子，表示这两个句子之间存在并列关系。第一个句子是Last April, Tencent and Douyin agreed to a partnership in video content distribution，表示腾讯和抖音在去年4月达成了一项关于视频内容分发的合作协议。第二个句子是after years of contentious copyright disputes，表示在经过多年的版权纠纷之后。这两个句子之间存在并列关系，表示腾讯和抖音在去年4月达成了一项关于视频内容分发的合作协议，这是在经过多年的版权纠纷之后发生的。

  • 过去完成时 - 用于表示在过去某个时间或动作发生之前已经完成的动作或状态。

      • 原文例句：Tencent authorised Douyin to distribute its video content and clarify copyright rules for users to produce modifications and adaptations.

      语法讲解：在这个例句中，过去完成时态被用来表示在授权抖音分发其视频内容和澄清用户修改和改编的版权规则之前，腾讯已经完成了一个动作或状态。这个动作或状态是授权抖音分发其视频内容和澄清用户修改和改编的版权规则。这个动作或状态发生在某个过去的时间或动作发生之前，所以使用了过去完成时态。

  • Collaborations among these Big Tech firms ‘are far from deep’, according to an article by Securities Times
  • The call to break more digital barriers in China’s internet industry comes days before Tencent’s Honour of Kings returns to Douyin’s platform

China’s internet giants must accelerate efforts to open up their “walled gardens”, enabling their ecosystems to work across platforms as a means “to face market pressures together” and assure the industry’s further expansion, according to state-owned media.

At present, collaborations among these companies “are far from deep”, said an article published on Tuesday by Shenzhen-based Securities Times, a financial newspaper owned by the Chinese Communist Party mouthpiece People’s Daily.

The call to break more digital barriers in China’s internet industry comes days before Tencent Holdings’ Honour of Kings, the world’s most popular mobile game, officially returns to the popular live-streaming platform of ByteDance-owned Douyin, which has more than 600 million daily active users, from January 21.

“In the future, internet companies need to be more open-minded and inclusive to promote truly win-win cooperation in the industry,” the Securities Times article said.

The collaboration between ByteDance and Tencent comes amid the video gaming industry’s regulatory uncertainties and a weaker macro environment in China.

While China’s gross domestic product rose by 5.2 per cent year on year in 2023, the world’s second-largest economy still faced mounting concerns this year including waning investor confidence, a protracted property market slump and a weak private sector.

“Internet companies need to leverage each other to face the market pressures together,” the Securities Times article said.

TikTok owner ByteDance earlier this month confirmed that it was in talks with multiple potential buyers, including Tencent, to sell its video gaming operations.

Last April, Tencent and Douyin agreed to a partnership in video content distribution after years of contentious copyright disputes.

Tencent allows Douyin to air Honour of Kings videos as ByteDance exits gaming

Under that deal, Tencent authorised Douyin to distribute its video content and clarify copyright rules for users to produce modifications and adaptations. As a result, users of ByteDance-owned platforms Douyin, Xigua Video and Jinri Toutiao will be able to produce derivative works based on Tencent-owned videos.

There have been other cases of collaboration between rival internet platform operators over the years,

In November, Alibaba Group Holding’s grocery chain Freshippo opened a store on rival e-commerce giant JD.com. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Beijing wants to smash online walls but Big Tech treads carefully

Tencent’s super app WeChat and Alibaba’s Taobao and Tmall Group in September announced an expanded collaboration, which enabled users who click on advertisements on WeChat to be directed to shops and live-streaming campaigns on Taobao and Tmall.

In November 2021, Tencent opened WeChat to third-party online links including those of Douyin and Taobao.

In September that same year, Alibaba started allowing consumers to use Tencent’s WeChat Pay as a payment option on a number of its platforms including food delivery platform Ele.me, video-streaming platform Youku, online ticketing platform Damai and cross-border e-commerce platform Kaola.

item.title: China’s hi-tech manufacturing faces ‘extraordinary pressures’ as 2023 output stalls
item.description:
English summary:

  • China’s hi-tech manufacturing sector is facing challenges amid a faltering economy and escalating U.S. containment efforts.
  • The growth rate of hi-tech manufacturing output in China fell to a record low of 2.7% in 2023, down from 18.2% in 2021.
  • Investment in hi-tech manufacturing grew by 9.9% in 2023, but it was the slowest pace since records began in 2015.
  • Experts say China needs to return to higher economic growth and counteract U.S. decoupling in order to revive the hi-tech sector.
  • The global recession and US-China tensions are also exerting pressure on China’s hi-tech push.
  • The weak economic momentum is weighing on the market’s overall willingness to invest in hi-tech manufacturing.

  • 中国的制造业在经济疲软和美国不断加剧的遏制措施中面临挑战。
  • 2023 年，制造业产值增长率降至创纪录的 2.7%，远低于 2021 年的 18.2%。
  • 2023 年，制造业投资增长 9.9%，但这是自 2015 年开始记录以来的最慢增长。
  • 专家表示，中国需要恢复较高的经济增长并抵消美国的脱钩才能复兴制造业。
  • 全球经济衰退和中美紧张局势也给中国的制造业带来压力。
  • 经济疲软正在影响市场对制造业的整体投资意愿。

  • pace (n.) - /peɪs/ 速度，节奏。

    原文例句：falling behind an increase of 5 per cent from the overall manufacturing industry, marking the lowest level of growth since the National Bureau of Statistics started to release the figures in 2018.

    例句讲解： pace的本义是指“步调，速度”。在这个例句中，它泛指“增长速度，增长率”。

  • soar (v.) - /sɔː(r)/ 飞涨，猛增。

    原文例句：The hi-tech manufacturing industry had seen its growth soar to a record high of 18.2 per cent in 2021 before easing to 7.4 per cent in 2022.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Old English，本义是指“高飞”，引申为“飞涨，猛增”。在这个例句中，它描述了制造业的增长率在 2021 年飙升至创纪录的 18.2%，然后在 2022 年放缓至 7.4%。

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语，由dis-（分开，消除）和rumpere（破裂）组成，意为“使破裂，使扰乱”。在这个例句中，它指的是由新冠病毒引发的全球供应链中断。

词组：

  • pin one's hopes on - 将希望寄托在……身上。

    原文例句：Beijing has pinned its hopes on innovation and technology to power the world’s second-largest economy as it seeks to find new growth engines.

    例句讲解：pin one's hopes on 是一个固定短语，意为“将希望寄托在……身上”。在这个例句中，它指的是北京将希望寄托在创新和技术上，以推动世界第二大经济体的发展，并寻找新的增长引擎。

  • go public - 上市。

    原文例句：Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuations

    例句讲解：go public是金融领域的常用短语，意为“上市”。在这个例句中，它指的是即使这些科技制造商成功上市，潜在的制裁也会影响它们的市值。

  • return to growth - 恢复增长。

    原文例句：The hi-tech recovery will require China to return to higher economic growth and counteract US decoupling.

    例句讲解：return to growth是一个经济领域的短语，意为“恢复增长”。在这个例句中，它指的是制造业的复苏需要中国恢复较高的经济增长，并抵消美国的脱钩政策。

  • 虚拟语气 - 表示虚拟，假设或愿望的情况。

    原文例句：“The hi

    • Industrial output from hi-tech manufacturers rose by 2.7 per cent year on year in 2023, but this marked the lowest level of growth since records began in 2018
    • Beijing has pinned its hopes on innovation and technology to power the world’s second-largest economy as it seeks to find new growth engines

    Output from China’s hi-tech manufacturing sector grew at the slowest pace on record last year amid a faltering economy and ever-escalating containment efforts from the United States, with the decline weighing on Beijing’s march towards superpower status.

    Industrial output from hi-tech manufacturers rose by 2.7 per cent year on year in 2023, falling behind an increase of 5 per cent from the overall manufacturing industry, marking the lowest level of growth since the National Bureau of Statistics started to release the figures in 2018.

    The hi-tech manufacturing industry had seen its growth soar to a record high of 18.2 per cent in 2021 before easing to 7.4 per cent in 2022, having stood at 7.1 per cent in 2020 amid coronavirus-induced disruptions to the global supply chain.

    Beijing has pinned its hopes on innovation and technology to power the world’s second-largest economy as it seeks to find new growth engines to replace the real estate sector, address its demographic challenges and move up the advanced industrial chain.

    Investment in hi-tech manufacturing grew by 9.9 per cent last year, beating the 6.5 per cent increase seen in the overall manufacturing industry, but the financing still registered the slowest pace since records began in 2015.

    Peng Peng, executive chairman of the Guangdong Society of Reform, said the sector is heading into a cooling period after years of rapid expansion.

    “The latest economic data indicate that the whole economic recovery is weak, and market confidence in many sectors is shaky, including tech,” he said.

    “The hi-tech recovery will require China to return to higher economic growth and counteract US decoupling.

    “It also demands the country’s ability to adapt to deglobalisation, but maintain a strong global exporter role.”

    Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuationsChen Zhiwu

    In December, the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology said it would increase funding to nurture the transformation of traditional manufacturers into hi-tech producers.

    It said China’s hi-tech manufacturing industry was currently facing challenges from insufficient innovation and increasing external pressure.

    Chen Zhiwu, a chair professor of finance at the University of Hong Kong, said headwinds such as risks of a global recession and US-China tensions would continue to exert “extraordinary pressures” on China’s hi-tech push.

    ‘More, better’: premier urges China to focus on application of core technologies

    “The US tech war has largely thwarted Chinese tech companies’ [initial public offering] opportunities. Even if these tech manufacturers succeed in going public, the potential sanctions would affect their market valuations,” said Chen.

    He added China’s weak economic momentum is also weighing on the market’s overall willingness to invest, with hi-tech manufacturing just one element.

    “The rapid development of hi-tech industries over the past 20 years has provided China with a massive boost to its economic boom, this was partly due to the impact of a stable external environment on investor confidence,” Chen said.

    “Many hi-tech companies I’ve surveyed recently said that market demand for tech products is relatively low, and with uncertain market sentiment, consumers are tightening their wallets so much that companies have to cut back on production.”

item.title: Saudi Arabia is eyeing a ‘sizeable’ investment to kick off kingdom’s foray into semiconductors
item.description:
English summary：

In a quest to diversify its economy from oil, Saudi Arabia's sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund (PIF), plans to invest heavily in the semiconductor and space industries this year. The PIF aims to lead the Saudi efforts in the semiconductor industry under a selected champion. Additionally, it intends to establish a national space company for investment and acquisition in the space sector, seeing it as an opportune time for mergers and acquisitions. The PIF's investments are part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's plan to reduce Saudi Arabia's reliance on oil sales and transform the economy.
  • Abstract: Saudi Arabia's PIF intends to make substantial investments in semiconductors and space.
  • Theme: Economic diversification efforts of Saudi Arabia through large-scale investments in various industries, especially semiconductors and space.
  • Viewpoint: The significance of the semiconductor and space industries in Saudi Arabia's economic transformation; the fund's efforts to attract investment from both US and Chinese tech companies.
  • Main information: PIF's investment plans in the semiconductor industry; establishment of a national space company; the fund's growth and role in Saudi Arabia's economic diversification; the space program and regional leadership ambitions; investment in communications as part of space investments.

Chinese summary：

沙特阿拉伯为了经济多元化，以摆脱对石油的依赖，其主权财富基金公共投资基金（PIF）计划今年对半导体和航天产业进行大量投资。PIF的目标是在半导体行业中选出一个引领者，带领沙特的努力。此外，它还打算成立一家国家航天公司，对航天领域进行投资和收购，因为其视为并购的最佳时机。该基金的投资是王储穆罕默德·本·萨勒曼计划的一部分，旨在减少沙特对石油销售的依赖，并转型经济。
  • 摘要：沙特的PIF计划对半导体和航天进行大量投资。
  • 主题：沙特通过对各个行业的大规模投资，尤其是半导体和航天，实现经济多元化。
  • 观点：半导体和航天产业在沙特经济转型中的重要性；该基金努力吸引来自美国和中国科技公司的投资。
  • 主要信息：PIF在半导体行业的投资计划；成立一家国家航天公司；该基金的增长及其在沙特经济多元化中的作用；航天计划和地区领导野心；作为航天投资一部分的通信投资。

Words：

  • diversify (v.) - /dɪˈvɜːsɪfaɪ/ 使多样化，多元化。

    原文例句：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil.

    例句讲解：这个词来源于Latin，由di-（分开）和versus（转向）组成，意为“使变化，使多样化”。在这个例句中，它描述了沙特阿拉伯为了经济多元化，以 摆脱对石油的依赖，计划加大在半导体和太空行业的投资力度。

  • sovereign wealth fund - 主权财富基金。

    原文例句：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil.

    例句讲解：这个词组由sovereign（主权的）和wealth fund（财富基金）组成，表示“一国政府为投资、储蓄或养老经济而建立的特殊投资基金”。在这个例句中，它指的是沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金，即公共投资基金（PIF），该基金计划今年加大对半导体和太空行业的投资力度，以实现经济多元化。

Phrases：

  • make investments in - 进行投资。

    原文例句：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由make（做，制造）和investments（投资）组成，表示“进行投资，投资于”。在这个例句中，它表示沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金计划今年加大对半导体和太空行业的投资力度。

Sentences：

  • Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil. - 沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金计划今年加大对半导体和太空行业的投资力度，以摆脱对石油的依赖，实现经济多元化。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments，其中主语是Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund，谓语是is planning to make big investments，宾语是in both the semiconductor and space industries。as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil是一个时间状语从句，表示时间和原因，即沙特阿拉伯为了经济多元化，以摆脱对石油的依赖，正在加快努力。

Grammar：

  • 现在进行时 - 表示正在进行的动作。

    原文例句：Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：am/is/are + 现在分词。其中am/is/are要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，现在分词是动词的-ing形式。这种时态表示动作或状态正在进行，强调动作或状态的进行性。在这个例句中，它表示沙特阿拉伯的主权财富基金计划今年加大对半导体和太空行业的投资力度，以实现经济多元化，这个动作正在进行中。

  • The Public Investment Fund is looking at making a “sizeable investment” this year into the semiconductor industry, the Saudi communications minister said
  • PIF plans to make an announcement on a particular champion within the space to lead the Saudi efforts, the minister said

Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund is planning to make big investments in both the semiconductor and space industries this year as the kingdom accelerates efforts to diversify its economy away from oil.

The Public Investment Fund is looking at making a “sizeable investment” this year into the semiconductor industry, Saudi Minister of Communications and Information Technology Abdullah Al-Swaha said in an interview at the World Economic Forum in Davos. “They plan to make an announcement on a particular champion within the space to lead the Saudi efforts,” he said, declining to give further details.

Alswaha, who is chairman of the kingdom’s Space Agency as well, said the fund will also look to create a national space company to invest and acquire assets in that sector. The space industry is “ripe right now” for M&A, he said.

The fund, known as PIF, has emerged as one of the key parts of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s plan to shake up the Saudi economy and wean it off a reliance on oil sales. It has rapidly built up assets of around US$700 billion after a spending spree on everything from electric carmakers to backing upstart golf tournaments, and plans to control US$1 trillion by 2025.

Saudi Arabia to use Hong Kong as bridge to China’s tech prowess

One of its key initiatives has been to develop an auto manufacturing hub on the west coast of the kingdom. US EV maker Lucid Group is already assembling cars from the site, and is set to be joined by Hyundai Motor and Ceer, a brand created by the PIF. The plan involves developing downstream industries that is expected to also include making semiconductors and batteries.

The kingdom launched its space programme in 2018 and sent astronauts into space last year, as part of a wider plan to invest in the industry.

“The new space economy is definitely the next trillion-dollar opportunity,” Al-Swaha said. “The kingdom is very bullish on not only becoming a regional leader in this space but also a global leader. The ambition by 2030 is to definitely establish regional leadership and then move on by 2040 to global leadership.”

A key part of Saudi Arabia’s space investments will be in communications, Alswaha said. “2.6 billion people in 2024 are still not connected and the only way to connect the unconnected is from the skies.”

Alswaha said that Saudi Arabia expects to be able to continue to attract investment from both US and Chinese technologies companies, even as tensions between the world’s two largest economies escalate. The kingdom “has demonstrated our partnership with both east and west on protecting their intellectual property and patents and any potential technology leakage,” Alswaha said.

Saudi Arabia is “pro-investment, pro-partnership and open market,” he said. “Anybody that complies with our regulatory, security requirements, serves our national interest, we will work with.”

item.title: Huawei chases enterprise clients in South Korea as consumers hold onto Samsung, Apple smartphones
item.description:
English summary：

Huawei is having a hard time making its presence in the South Korean smartphone market and is trying to expand its cloud business in South Korea.
  • Huawei is expected to make a global smartphone market comeback in 2024.
  • In South Korea, Huawei faces strong competition from Samsung and Apple, and has a market share of only 0.1%.
  • Huawei is trying to expand its cloud business in South Korea, targeting the local tech and entertainment industries.

中文总结：

华为在韩国智能手机市场很难获得立足之地，该公司正试图扩大其在韩国的云业务。
  • 预计华为将在2024年卷土重来智能手机全球市场。
  • 在韩国，华为面临来自三星和苹果的激烈竞争，市场份额仅为0.1%。
  • 华为正试图扩大其在韩国的云业务，目标是当地的科技和娱乐行业。

单词：

  • forecast (v.) - /ˈfɔːrˌkæst/ 预测，预报。

    原文例句：Huawei is forecast to move into the spotlight in the smartphone industry in 2024, with projected double-digit growth in global shipments, according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights, which described the Chinese company as a potential “big surprise”.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古英语“fore-”（之前，前面）和“cast”（投掷，送出），表示“向前投掷，预测”。在这个例句中，它指的是华为在2024年将成为智能手机行业的一大亮点，据研究公司TechInsights上周发布的一份报告称，其全球出货量预计将实现两位数增长，报告称这家中国公司可能成为一个“大惊喜”。

  • secure (v.) - /sɪˈkjʊər/ 确保，保护。

    原文例句：But in Korea – home to smartphone and semiconductor titan Samsung Electronics – Huawei is struggling to expand its market share or secure trust from local partners amid the US-China tech rivalry, analysts said.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于拉丁语“securus”（安全的，放心的），表示“使安全，使放心”。在这个例句中，它指的是华为在韩国正努力扩大其市场份额或获得当地合作伙伴的信任，但分析师表示，由于美中科技竞争，该公司在韩国很难做到这一点。

词组：

  • make a comeback - 卷土重来。

    原文例句：Chinese telecommunications equipment giant Huawei Technologies is poised to make a comeback in the global smartphone market this year, but in South Korea, the company must contend with the lingering impact of US sanctions and intense competition with international and local rivals, according to industry watchers.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由make（做，制造）和comeback（回来，重返）构成的，表示“再次回来或重新出现”。在这个例句中，它指的是华为准备在今年的全球智能手机市场上卷土重来，但据行业观察人士称，该公司在韩国必须应对美国制裁的持续影响以及与国际和本地竞争对手的激烈竞争。

句子：

  • In Korea – home to smartphone and semiconductor titan Samsung Electronics – Huawei is struggling to expand its market share or secure trust from local partners amid the US-China tech rivalry, analysts said. - 在韩国——智能手机和半导体巨头三星电子的所在地——分析人士表示，由于中美科技竞争，华为正努力扩大市场份额或获得当地合作伙伴的信任。

    句子分析：这是一个主谓宾结构的复合句，主句是Huawei is struggling，其中主语是Huawei，谓语是is struggling，宾语是to expand its market share or secure trust from local partners。In Korea – home to smartphone and semiconductor titan Samsung Electronics –是一个介词短语，作地点状语，表示在韩国——智能手机和半导体巨头三星电子的所在地。amid the US-China tech rivalry是一个介词短语，作原因状语，表示由于中美科技竞争。

语法：

  • 现在分词短语 - 表示动作或状态发生的时间或原因。

    原文例句：The company’s enterprise products include data centre networks, campus networks and storage services.

    语法讲解：这是一个现在分词短语，由现在分词include和名词products构成的，作定语，修饰products，表示该公司的企业产品包括数据中心网络、校园网络和存储服务。

  • 过去分词短语 - 表示动作或状态发生的时间或结果。

    原文例句：Huawei made a splash in its home market China last August with the surprise launch of the Mate 60 Pro handset equipped with an advanced, domestically-developed 5G chip.

    语法讲解：这是一个过去分词短语，由过去分词equipped和名词chip构成的，作伴随状语，修饰handset，表示该手机配备了先进的、国内研发的5G芯片。

  • Huawei is unlikely to gain ground in the South Korean smartphone market, which is dominated by Samsung and Apple, analysts say
  • The Chinese firm’s new cloud division in the country is eyeing business from the local tech and entertainment industries

This article was first published by The Korea Times in a partnership with the South China Morning Post.

Chinese telecommunications equipment giant Huawei Technologies is poised to make a comeback in the global smartphone market this year, but in South Korea, the company must contend with the lingering impact of US sanctions and intense competition with international and local rivals, according to industry watchers.

Huawei is forecast to move into the spotlight in the smartphone industry in 2024, with projected double-digit growth in global shipments, according to a report published last week by research firm TechInsights, which described the Chinese company as a potential “big surprise”.

But in Korea – home to smartphone and semiconductor titan Samsung Electronics – Huawei is struggling to expand its market share or secure trust from local partners amid the US-China tech rivalry, analysts said.

The Shenzhen-based company, which has been offering various products and services to Korean customers for two decades, has been effectively absent from the country’s smartphone market in the past few years due to its “inability to source 5G chipsets”, said Abhilash Kumar, an analyst at TechInsights.

“South Korea’s smartphone market is 5G-heavy, with a 5G penetration of more than 95 per cent for 2023, so it made little sense for consumers to buy Huawei’s 4G-powered phones,” he said.

Since 2019, Washington has barred the Chinese company, on national security grounds, from accessing US technologies including Google’s most popular apps, which are commonly pre-installed in Android phones sold by rivals like Samsung. That has dealt a heavy blow to Huawei’s overseas sales.

Huawei, which briefly surpassed Samsung to lead global smartphone shipments in early 2020, has dropped out of the global top five since 2021. Last year, the world’s five biggest smartphone vendors were Apple, Samsung, Xiaomi, Transsion and Vivo, according to a report published on Monday by research firm IDC.

In Korea, Huawei had a market share of just 0.1 per cent as of December, far lagging Samsung’s 68.7 per cent and Apple’s 26.5 per cent, numbers from online database Statcounter showed.

Huawei made a splash in its home market China last August with the surprise launch of the Mate 60 Pro handset equipped with an advanced, domestically-developed 5G chip. The company is reportedly aiming to bring its handsets back to some overseas markets, including in Europe.

Still, “it looks unlikely” that the firm would return to the Korean smartphone market, Kumar said.

“Now that Huawei might have managed to source 5G chipsets locally,” he said. “It’s still difficult for it because [South Korea] is Samsung- and Apple-heavy and doesn’t have much acceptance for Chinese vendors.”

Huawei has tried to launch both premium and affordable smartphones in Korea since 2014, but it has been unable to gain ground “largely due to local operators’ preference for Samsung,” said Woody Oh, service director at TechInsights. “To be successful in the Korean market, [manufacturers] must seek operators’ support.”

Amid difficulties in the consumer market, Huawei is pinning its hopes on enterprise services, according to Wang Balian, CEO of Huawei Korea.

The Huawei-supported 5G network used by Korean carriers ranked first in global tests last year, Wang said at a year-end event in Seoul last month. The company’s enterprise products include data centre networks, campus networks and storage services.

Wang said the company was also expanding its foothold in the cloud computing market, having established a cloud division in Korea last year in hope of serving the information technology and cultural entertainment industries.

The executive highlighted Huawei’s commitment to the Korean market despite running into controversies last year, when SK Hynix – the second-largest memory chip maker in Korea – announced it was investigating how its products ended up in the Mate 60 Pro.

Hynix said at the time that it “no longer does business with Huawei since the introduction of the US restrictions against the company”.

One of Huawei’s key business partners in Korea is LG Electronics. Wang called LG Uplus, South Korea’s third-largest mobile carrier and the country’s sole mobile network operator using Huawei’s 5G base stations, has been touted as one of the Chinese firm’s “important global clients”.

Looking to 2024, Wang said Huawei Korea, which has more than 230 employees, planned to help the country achieve its digitisation and carbon neutrality goals, while continuing to support the cultivation of 1,000 next-generation information technology professionals.

item.title: Should we let AI take over mundane work? Not so fast
item.description:
Summary：

English: Although outsourcing tasks to generative AI seems to boost productivity, it can limit supplementary learning and should be carefully used. Generative AI has limitations, including incorrect results due to insufficient data, bias, and incorrect assumptions, raising concerns about its impact on human capabilities. Simplified Chinese：将任务外包给生成式人工智能，如 ChatGPT，乍看起来似乎可以提高生产率，但实际上可能会限制人们在执行某些任务时获得的补充学习，因此必须谨慎部署人工智能。生成式人工智能存在局限性，包括由于数据不足、偏见和不正确的假设而导致的结果不正确或具有误导性，这引发了人们对其对人类能力影响的担忧。
  • Abstract: Outsourcing tasks to generative AI: impact on human capabilities.
  • Theme: The potential benefits and limitations of using generative AI, particularly ChatGPT, in various settings, including companies, schools, and research institutions.
  • Viewpoint: The importance of considering both work output and learning when deploying generative AI, with a focus on avoiding negative impacts on human capabilities.
  • Main information: Examples of generative AI's limitations, such as incorrect results and lack of inter-task learning; the impact of outsourcing bug reporting on Python maintainers' productivity; the need to distinguish between work output and learning when using generative AI; suggestions for managing generative AI use in organizations and schools.

总结：

英语：尽管将任务外包给生成式人工智能似乎可以提高生产力，但它可能会限制补充学习，应该谨慎使用。生成式人工智能存在局限性，包括由于数据不足、偏见和不正确的假设而导致的结果不正确或具有误导性，这引发了人们对其对人类能力影响的担忧。 简体中文：将任务外包给生成式人工智能，例如 ChatGPT，乍看起来似乎可以提高生产率，但实际上可能会限制人们在执行某些任务时获得的补充学习，因此必须谨慎部署人工智能。生成式人工智能存在局限性，包括由于数据不足、偏见和不正确的假设而导致的结果不正确或具有误导性，这引发了人们对其对人类能力影响的担忧。
  • 摘要：利用生成式人工智能处理任务：对人类能力的影响。
  • 主题：在各种场景（包括公司、学校和研究机构）中使用生成式人工智能（尤其是 ChatGPT）的潜在好处和局限性。
  • 观点：在部署生成式人工智能时，既要考虑工作产出，也要考虑学习，重点在于避免对人类能力产生负面影响。
  • 主要信息：生成式人工智能局限性的示例，例如结果不正确和缺乏任务间学习；外包错误报告对 Python 维护人员工作效率的影响；在使用生成式人工智能时需要区分工作产出和学习；关于在组织和学校中管理生成式人工智能使用的建议。

单词：

  • deployment (n.) - /dɪˈplɔɪmənt/ 部署，配置。

    原文例句：This tool is expected to be deployed in companies and other organisations to enhance worker productivity.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于deploy，意为“部署，配置，配置”。在这个例句中，它指的是这一工具预计将被部署到公司和其他组织中，以提高工人的生产率。

  • enhance (v.) - /ɪnˈhæns/ 提高，改善，增强。

    原文例句：This tool is expected to be deployed in companies and other organisations to enhance worker productivity.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于en-（使……成为）和hance（提升，增加），意为“提高，改善，增强”。在这个例句中，它指的是这一工具预计将被部署到公司和其他组织中，以提高工人的生产率。

词组：

  • by nature - 从本质上来说，本质上。

    原文例句：Second, start classifying tasks by nature, in terms of whether they are interrelated.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由by（通过，按）和nature（自然，本质）构成的，表示“从本质上来说，本质上”。在这个例句中，它表示从本质上来说，即任务的性质或类型。

句子：

  • We must seek to prevent the unrestrained use of generative AI in homework or assignments. - 我们必须设法阻止在家庭作业或作业中不受限制地使用生成式人工智能。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是We must seek to prevent the unrestrained use of generative AI in homework or assignments，其中主语是We，谓语是must seek to prevent，宾语是the unrestrained use of generative AI in homework or assignments。prevent the unrestrained use of generative AI in homework or assignments是一个不定式作宾语，表示“阻止在家庭作业或作业中不受限制地使用生成式人工智能”。这个句子的意思是说，我们必须设法阻止在家庭作业或作业中不受限制地使用生成式人工智能。

语法：

  • reported speech - 报道言语。

    原文例句：Python maintainers not only discovered fewer bugs after the IBB program, they also made fewer enhancements to Python.

    语法讲解：这是一个复杂的句子，包含一个主句和一个从句。主句是Python maintainers not only discovered fewer bugs after the IBB program，从句是they also made fewer enhancements to Python。主句的时态是过去时，从句的时态也是过去时。从句中的they是指主句中的Python maintainers。这个句子的意思是说，Python维护者在IBB计划之后不仅发现的错误更少了，也对Python的改进更少了。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由主语以外的人或物引起的。

    原文例句：In fact, AI-generated content is so good that it reads almost as if it was written by a human being.

    语法讲解：这是一个被动语态的句子，其中was written是过去分词，by a human being是介词短语，作施事者。这个句子的意思是说，事实上，AI生成的内容非常好，读起来几乎就像是由人类写的。

  • It may seem that outsourcing tasks to generative AI like ChatGPT could increase productivity
  • However, it might actually limit the supplementary learning that occurs when people do certain tasks, so AI must be deployed with care

Generative artificial intelligence, especially OpenAI’s implementation of ChatGPT, has opened up new possibilities for the creation of intelligent content. In fact, AI-generated content is so good that it reads almost as if it was written by a human being.

For example, a study by researchers from US universities published in May found that when answering random patient questions from a social media platform, ChatGPT outperformed physicians in terms of both quality of information and empathy. And OpenAI has a said GPT4, the state-of-the-art model underlying ChatGPT Plus, could score in the top 10 per cent in the SAT reading exam for college admissions, the GRE verbal test for graduate school admissions and the uniform bar exam for lawyers.

This tool is expected to be deployed in companies and other organisations to enhance worker productivity. Schools and teachers are also keen to embrace it. Many universities now allow students to use generative AI in course work and assignments. Some local institutions offer free access to ChatGPT, encouraging students to use it in school.

However, generative AI has its limitations. Because the content it produces is generated from a complex large-language model instead of logically developed and based on facts, AI sometimes “hallucinates”, that is, produces incorrect or misleading results, due to insufficient training data, bias and incorrect assumptions. In June, two lawyers in the US were sanctioned for using ChatGPT to produce a legal brief with fictitious case citations. They claimed they weren’t aware ChatGPT could make up cases.

This case raises an important question: how does generative AI affect human capability when people no longer need to develop logical arguments and verify facts when creating content?

Using generative AI to produce work is akin to outsourcing it to other people. Thus, we can infer its impact on human capability by referencing outsourcing.

We conducted research on how contributions to the well-known programming language, Python, changed after the introduction of a crowdsourcing program called Internet Bug Bounty (IBB), which rewards people for finding security vulnerabilities in open source software – but excludes the official system maintainers, who have been reporting and fixing bugs, and making enhancements, from the reward.

The IBB program should have made the Python maintainers’ job easier, giving them more time to perform other tasks and hence increasing their productivity in those tasks.

Interestingly, we found the opposite. The official Python maintainers not only discovered fewer bugs after the IBB program, they also made fewer enhancements to Python. This means their overall productivity fell after bug reporting was outsourced.

We looked at many reasons for the drop in productivity, including a loss of motivation due to not being rewarded in the IBB program. We concluded that it was mainly due to a lack of inter-task learning. There was a bigger drop in productivity among Python maintainers who reported more bugs before the IBB program than those who reported fewer. The drop was also bigger when the bug reporting and enhancement tasks were more closely related.

We surveyed a number of Python maintainers, most of whom said that finding vulnerabilities helped them learn and gain ideas for how to enhance the program. This implies that when performing a task, we not only contribute to the outcome, we learn at the same time.

This inter-task learning side-effect is illuminating. It suggests that learning and other capabilities may be sacrificed when we enjoy the power and convenience of generative AI. The short-term gain in productivity could be offset by the long-term loss in capability. Worse, this capability may be key to our contribution to future tasks, including, possibly, intelligent knowledge work.

So how should generative AI use be managed in an organisation? First, distinguish between objectives – are we seeking work output or learning and training? In most places, work output may be the priority, so it would be reasonable to actively deploy generative AI tools. Even so, we must be aware this may slow employees’ learning of how to perform tasks.

Second, start classifying tasks by nature, in terms of whether they are interrelated. Generative AI tools may be better deployed for tasks that have little relation to other tasks, for example, pure automation jobs. We might wish to discourage AI’s use for deeply intertwined tasks.

Third, more training should be provided once generative AI is deployed. People are intrinsically lazy. If we let them use generative AI without supplementing it with learning opportunities, their ability may deteriorate over time.

At school, the priority should be learning rather than work output. We must seek to prevent the unrestrained use of generative AI in homework or assignments. If students don’t do homework themselves but outsource it entirely to AI, they may soon lose the ability to reason, innovate and produce more advanced knowledge.

We must revisit the common question, “Why waste time doing mundane work when AI can do it for us?” This is a dangerous sentiment because we do work not only to produce an outcome, but to learn as well. Such learning builds the foundation for future knowledge production.

We should not get carried away by generative AI, thinking that only work outcomes matter. The learning itself is equally important, if not more so.
